intro: Memecylon grande var. merguicum, commonly known as the Merguic Mecylon, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
